name: Perfect Cheesecake Everytime
author: Cheesecakemama
summary: I came up with this because I wanted simple, but elegant too.  I wanted the taste of restaurant cheesecake, but something simple to prepare--because I did not want to measure the sour cream, I dumped in the whole container. I also did not want to bake for an hour, so that is where the 30 minute shut-off of the oven comes into play. I shut off the oven and do not open door for 6 hours or leave in oven all night. This will get you great reviews from friends. You also will not order cheesecake out again. If it cracks, garnish with fruit to hide the cracks.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk together the crushed graham crackers, the 1 teaspoon sugar, cinnamon, and walnuts
Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
Remove from oven; allow crust to cool
Beat the cream cheese with the eggs on medium-low with an electric mixer until smooth
Beat in the 1 cup sugar and vanilla
Fold in the sour cream just until blended
Do not overmix; ovemixing causes the cheesecake to crack
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
When the cheesecake has reached room temperature, chill in refrigerator for 8 hours before serving
